identificationModule.briefTitle: Adaptive Sports for Individuals With a Physical Disability : Effect Among Stroke Survivors
identificationModule.officialTitle: L'activitié Physique Sportive organisée Pour Sujets en Situation de Handicap : Impact Chez Les Sujets Post-accident Vasculaire cérébrale, Sur Les Trois Domaines de la Classification Internationale du Fonctionnement, du Handicap et de la santé (CIF)

leadSponsor.name: Cliniques universitaires Saint-Luc- Université Catholique de Louvain

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The objective of the study is to evaluate the effect of engaging in adaptive sports for individuals who have had a stroke. The study is cross-sectional, participants with stroke will be recruited and divided into two groups: the first group composed of individuals with stroke who regularly participate in adaptive sports; and the second of individuals with stroke who do not regularly participate in adaptive sports. The two groups will have to be similar in terms of demographic variables (age, gender, time since beginning of stroke). A series of parameters will be tested, on one occasion for each participant. The two groups will then be compared to one another.

armGroups.label: Adaptive sports group
armGroups.description: Individuals with stroke who regularly, and on a long-term basis, participate in adaptive sports

armGroups.label: Non adaptive sports group
armGroups.description: Individuals with stroke who do not engage in adaptive sports

interventions.name: Adaptive sports
interventions.description: Participation in community adaptive sports programs

primaryOutcomes.description: Measured through a 6 minute-walk test where participants walk back and forth from one cone to another (placed 30 meters away), during 6 minutes. The distance walked in the 6 minutes is calculated.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Measured through a sub-maximal effort test on cycle ergometer.
Measured by the Fugl-Meyer Assessment. The score ranges from 0-226, where lower scores represent greater motor impairment.
Measured using a manual dynamometer (microfet), in flexion, extension, adduction, abduction, internal rotation and external rotation of each limb.
Measured using the Functional Independence Measure. Total scores range from 8 to 126 points. A lower score corresponds to complete dependence/no autonomy.
Measured by the timed up and go test.
Measured by the 10 meter walk test.
Measured by the Abiloco questionnaire. Score ranges from 0 to 13, where lower scores represent loss locomotion ability.
Measured by the Activities-specific balance confidence scale. Scores range from 0 to 160, where higher score mean better confidence in balance.

Measured by the Physical activity scale for individuals with physical disabilities. Scores range from 0 to 199.5 MET hour per day, where a greater score represents a greater level of physical activity.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Volume of physical activity performed daily

secondaryOutcomes.description: Measured by the fatigue severity scale. Scores range from 9 to 63 where a higher score represents greater fatigue severity.
Measured by the EUROHIS-QOL (European Health Interview Survey, Quality of Life) 8 item questionnaire. Scores range from 0 to 40, with a greater score representing a better quality of life.
Measured by the Return to normal living index, a scale ranging from 0 to 100, with a greater score for greater social participation.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Intensity of physical activity performed daily
secondaryOutcomes.description: Measured by a heart rate monitor

otherOutcomes.description: Questionnaire asking participants to report age, gender, date of stroke, type of stroke as well as number of weekly sessions in any type of organised physical activity.
Questionnaire asking participants to report any medication taken at the time of study participation, number of weekly sessions of physiotherapy and number of weekly sessions of other therapy.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* diagnosis of stroke since at least 6 months prior to recruitment in the study
* persistent physical disability due to the stroke
* adequate understanding of french

Exclusion Criteria:

* significant cognitive impairments
* contra-indication of any type to performing physical activity and physical exercise
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: The study population are individuals with a stroke diagnosis since a minimum of 6 months prior to the study. These individuals have to present persistent physical disability due to their stroke. The investigators will recruit individuals with stroke who participate in organised adaptive sports programs on a regular basis, as well as individuals who do not participate in any oranised adaptive sports programs.
